bug.author: kyeotic
bug.summary: Error in AWS generate platform output
bug.description:
When running the command from the <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/deploy/install-kubeflow/>Install with AWS docs</denchmark-link> this error is thrown <denchmark-code>loading config file "/Users/tkye/dev/callysto/src/callysto/aws_config/cluster_config.yaml": no kind "ClusterConfig" is registered for version "eksctl.io/v1alpha4" in scheme "k8s.io/client-go/kubernetes/scheme/register.go:60" </denchmark-code>
Changing the cluster_config.yml to point to apiVersion: eksctl.io/v1alpha5 fixes it

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.97. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tyrsius>@tyrsius</denchmark-link>
Thanks for reporting this issue! New version of eksctl is not compatible with older API versions. We are talking with eksctl team to either add support or we generate cluster spec based on user's eksctl version. In progress of it.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/pull/3280>#3280</denchmark-link> File a PR to address this issue for short term. eksctl will guarantee backward compatibility in next release
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
This has been fixed and Let's close this issue. /close

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link> : Closing this issue.

This has been fixed and Let's close this issue. /close
